title: Stock Futures Waver Ahead of Bank Earnings; Results are due from Citigroup, Wells Fargo, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley
text:
In Europe, the Stoxx Europe 600 rose 0.1% in morning trade as gains in consumer discretionary and real-estate sectors were tempered by losses in healthcare and energy sectors.

The U.K.'s FTSE 100 was down 0.3%. Other stock indexes in Europe mostly climbed as France's CAC 40 gained 0.4%, the U.K.'s FTSE 250 added 0.2% and Germany's DAX climbed 0.2%.

The Swiss franc, the euro and the British pound were up 0.1%, 0.3% and 0.1% respectively against the U.S. dollar.

In commodities, international benchmark Brent crude declined 1.3% to $107.33 a barrel. Gold also fell 0.5% to $1,975.30 a troy ounce.

German 10-year bund yields strengthened to 0.778% and the 10-year gilts yield strengthened to 1.813%. 10-year U.S. Treasury yields fell to 2.675% from 2.688%. Bond yields move in the opposite directions to prices.

Indexes in Asia mostly climbed as Hong Kong's Hang Seng gained 0.8%, Japan's Nikkei 225 index rose 1.2% and China's benchmark Shanghai Composite climbed 1.2%.

Stock Futures Waver Ahead of Bank Earnings
